Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: myrtle leaf pattern with row of added white dots.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd a belonging to his group of South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. These cups coincide with Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type XI (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). These cups have been found in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Demeter and Kore at Tocra. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Hayes suggested a Rhodian origin for these types of cups but this is uncertain (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 114). Schlotzhauer points out that the same myrtle pattern is found on Fikellura style pottery from Miletus and thus suggest a South Ionian or more specifically Milesian origin for the cups (Schlotzhauer 2012, 108-9).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 301)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.811) (Phase 3)
